title: What is behind the rise in violence in the occupied West Bank?
description: Israel's attack on the Jenin refugee camp on Monday killed six Palestinians and injured many more.

title: Australia beat England by two wickets to win first Ashes Test
description: Australia captain Pat Cummins, partnering with tailender Nathan Lyon, sealed a thrilling victory with an unbeaten 44.

title: Crews race to find Titanic sub lost in vast North Atlantic
description: US coastguard official says authorities are conducting 'complex search effort' with 40 hours of oxygen left in vessel.

title: Carlos Ghosn sues Nissan, aims to ‘fight to the end’
description: The former Nissan chairman who was arrested in Japan in late 2018 has filed a $1bn suit in Lebanon where he is stuck.

title: China negotiating new military training facility in Cuba: Report
description: Wall Street Journal says talks over new military facility are in late stages, with US officials seeking to intervene.

title: US news chain Gannett sues Google, alleges online ad monopoly
description: Google's control over tools for buying, selling online ads forces publishers to sell more cheap ad space, Gannett says.

title: Iceland suspends whale hunting over animal rights concerns
description: Rights groups advocate an end to the slaughter and say the mammals are also under serious threat from climate change.

title: Estonia passes law to allow same-sex marriage
description: Prime Minister Kaja Kallas says she is 'proud of Estonia' after the bill received 55 votes in the 101-seat parliament.

title: Rwandan genocide suspect seeks asylum in South Africa
description: Former Rwandan police officer drops bail application and requests asylum in South Africa.

title: Germany’s spy agency cautions against voting for far-right AfD
description: Voters should bear in mind that far-right views pose the biggest threat to Germany's democracy, the agency says.

title: Amnesty urges end to ‘racist’ treatment of Haitian asylum seekers
description: Haitians face 'racism, xenophobia, systemic violence' in search for protection across Americas, rights group says.

title: US judge sets August 14 start date for Donald Trump trial
description: Early date, which remains tentative, shows federal judge's intent to move quickly with the classified documents case.

title: What’s driving DR Congo’s deadly conflict with M23?
description: Human rights groups say militia group has committed war crimes in region facing acute humanitarian crisis.

title: Four Israeli settlers killed in attack in the occupied West Bank
description: The shooting carried out by suspected Palestinians took place near the illegal settlement of Eli.

title: Afghanistan’s Taliban publicly executes man convicted of murder
description: Group carries out its second confirmed official execution since it returned to power in Afghanistan in 2021.

title: Joe Biden’s son Hunter agrees to plead guilty to federal charges
description: Hunter to plead guilty on two charges of failure to pay taxes, and is working on a deal on a firearms charge: Lawyer.

title: Darfur governor calls for international probe in Sudan violence
description: A senior aid worker was assassinated in el-Geneina as the RSF reportedly kept fighting in Darfur despite a ceasefire.

title: Hungary ignoring requests for contact with war prisoners: Ukraine
description: Kyiv says prisoner transfer serves Orban's interests, but Budapest claims POWs are free to leave.

title: Gaza’s blockade: Palestine’s Nakba lives on in new generations
description: Israel’s 16-year blockade of Gaza isn't just a political issue, but a daily reality that affects all aspects of life

title: French police raid Paris 2024 headquarters in corruption probe
description: Prosecutors say they are investigating Olympics organisers over alleged embezzlement of public funds and favouritism.

title: Football Love: Sudan’s first female football coach
description: The first FIFA-recognised Arab woman to coach men’s football shares her two love stories - for football and her husband.

title: Nigeria, labour unions to agree new minimum wage within 8 weeks
description: Nigeria's labour unions threatened to strike after fuel prices tripled due to President Tinubu scrapping fuel subsidy.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo’s 10 most memorable international moments
description: The veteran forward and global superstar is set to make a record-extending 200th international appearance for Portugal.

title: Shahzada Dawood, Hamish Harding: Who’s on missing Titanic sub?
description: A five-person submersible vessel taking tourists to see the wreckage of the Titanic is missing in the Atlantic.

title: Australian senator urges ICC probe into war crimes allegations
description: Jacqui Lambie calls on the ICC to investigate Australian military commanders over war crimes allegations in Afghanistan.

title: Greece boat tragedy: What do we know about the coastguard’s role?
description: The European Commission calls for 'thorough and transparent investigation' into the deadly sinking of a boat off Greece.

title: In a first, UN rights chief seeks presence in India and China
description: Volker Turk who took over UN body last year calls for greater political support to establish office in India and China.

title: Pakistan football team to play in India for first time since 2014
description: The bitter rivals will kick off the South Asian Football Federation (SAFF) Championship on Wednesday.

title: Parents submit DNA samples to ID Uganda school massacre victims
description: Many of the 42 bodies recovered from the attack were found charred beyond recognition.

title: Rwanda is no refuge for UK asylum seekers
description: Before welcoming those seeking refuge in the UK, Rwanda should tackle the issues that lead its own citizens to flee.

title: Romanian prosecutors send Andrew Tate to trial for trafficking
description: Despite the charges, Tate and his brother continue to deny the charges against them.

title: Why does Israel keep raiding the Jenin refugee camp?
description: Israel is concerned that Palestinians are increasingly taking up arms, with Jenin becoming a symbol of resistance.

title: Fight erupts in Somalia’s Puntland region after parliament debate
description: The clashes broke out after the opposition accused Puntland's leader of seeking constitutional changes to extend tenure.

title: Why it’s the most dangerous time to be a refugee
description: This World Refugee Day, refugees are more vulnerable than ever. So are those hosting them.

title: Refugees: Stories of Loss
description: “I could be one of them.”

title: Lab-grown synthetic human embryos lead to calls for regulation
description: Labs use stem cells to create structures looking like human embryo without sperm, egg or fertilisation.

title: Germany, China hold meeting amid tensions over trade, Ukraine
description: Trade, climate change and the war in Ukraine are on the agenda as Scholz meets Li on his first official foreign trip.
